sklarpy.tests.univariate package

Submodules

sklarpy.tests.univariate.conftest module

sklarpy.tests.univariate.helpers module

sklarpy.tests.univariate.helpers.get_data(name: str, continuous_data: ndarray, discrete_data: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

contains logic for selecting the correct data for a given distribution.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the distribution as in distributions_map

  • continuous_data (np.ndarray) – Random numbers generated from a continuous distribution

  • discrete_data (np.ndarray) – Random numbers generated from a discrete distribution

Returns:

data – The data to fit the distribution too.

Return type:

np.ndarray

sklarpy.tests.univariate.helpers.get_dist(name: str, data: ndarray) → tuple[source]

Fits a distribution to data.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the distribution as in distributions_map

  • data (np.ndarray) – The data to fit the distribution too

Returns:

res – non-fitted dist, fitted dist, parameters for fitted dist

Return type:

tuple

sklarpy.tests.univariate.helpers.get_target_fit(name: str, continuous_data: ndarray, discrete_data: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

contains logic for selecting the correct data for a given distribution.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the distribution as in distributions_map

  • continuous_data (np.ndarray) – Random numbers generated from a continuous distribution

  • discrete_data (np.ndarray) – Random numbers generated from a discrete distribution

Returns:

target_fit – The fitted distribution object target.

Return type:

np.ndarray
